I have had them for years but I had a strange feeling with this one and decided I was going in for a full check up right before age 60 including heart, breast, blood work etc. So I have all the baseline data done from the day I had a mammogram and the next day a biopsy and well here I am with stage 1 ilc waiting for my radiation.
Posts.Title: How were you diagnosed? Symptoms/Signs, etc? greenacres nelia48

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2007 11:25PM mcgaffey wrote: SwimmingMom, At the end of my treatment, I used a tight-fitting little T made of that stretch material. I got mine at Landsend and Marks and Spencers. They fit nicely around the breasts and protect the underarm by not having it be skin on skin. That's the trick. I didn't like anything at the end that was camisole like, sleeveless. Now I am back to sleeveless. I am very fair, smaller breasts, left-side, and no chemo. Everyone is different. I was so careful to keep my skin aired and creamed with what the docs suggested. I would go topless after treatment to let the creams soak in and then put on a top. You have to try things. It may be that you can put a bra over one of those "tightish" elasticized t-shirts. That may work. The bra won't be directly on your skin. I think that is the key. They marked me when I had my boosts daily so I wore navy so I wouldn't damage my tops. I am now recovering, skin is pinkish-tan, feel fine and am not over-tired. I think my daily walking helped me.
